text: Great Schwarma. It would be super great if they had amba for it. Decent service and pleasant atmosphere.  Good Chinese food.

Most of Montreal's Jewish community black market money is spent here. $10 and up for a sandwich is quite excessive for a fast-food Israeli restaurant. The only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars is because they prepare the best Shawarma in town. Why must we always get gouged for average kosher food??  Oh, and you have to try their 'Amba' (tangy mango sauce) and get loaded on the free spare pita corners.

My wife and I ate here and had the Grilled Chicken Breast with assorted salads including Israeli salad, cole slaw, sour pickle slices, chopped lettuce and tomatoes. It was Kosher and prepared very nicely. There was no waiter service and we picked up the order at the counter and helped select what salads we wanted on our plate.
Best shawarma I ate in Montreal (or in the US). They have those purple pickled things too! Very good.

A kosher deli-cum-chinese restaurant. There's a strange smell in the restaurant! The Pepper Beef Sandwich was okay - too many onions. The Kefta sandwich was okay too - a bit dry. The server behind the counter is a bit strange!

I love this place! It's one of the few places where you get just get a delicious plate of shwarma, humus, Israeli salad all smothered in tehina. I find the food is always fresh. It's a bit more expensive then some other Mediterranean places like Amir but that's because it's kosher and so they're cost are much higher.....but I think it's worth it. I've heard the Chinese food is good, but I always stick with the Israeli style dishes. The service is not great, but that could be expected from a behind the counter fast food style restaurant. It really has an authentic Israeli fee as it you were at a similar restaurant in Tel Aviv, Jaffa or Jerusalem.

La nourriture cacher se démarque à cause de ses prix plus élevés, notamment lorsqu'il s'agit de préparations à base de viande. Pour quelqu'un qui ne connaît pas toutes les subtilités et particularités qui entourent "l'univers du cacher", un repas chez Benny peut paraître hors de prix pour un self service. TOUTEFOIS, nous sommes loin du resto du clown. On pourrait se perdre en comparaison avec ce qu'on nous sert ici et ce qui attire les enfants, soit un M jaune gigantesque. Mais ce serait trop long. Chez Benny, c'est de la viande 100% au goût de viande. Bien marinée, cuite à la minute. Du pain frais, de qualité. Le tout préparé dans un environnement propre. Ici les classiques, du Maghreb à Bagdad,  se regroupent et ainsi, shawarma, kebab et autres salades marocaines à l'aubergine côtoient le baba ghannouj libanais.  Le comptoir asiatique, attenant à celui des grillades, offre une excellente nourriture, dont les classiques aigre-doux, général Tao, boeuf ou poulet. Et si vous hésitez à cause des prix, attendez de voir les portions!  Si vous êtes deux, ne commandez qu'une portion de frites. Avec les sandwichs, vous serez grandement rassasiés. À moins que ce ne soit un steak. Et comme Benny offre quelques vins, cacher, cela va de soi, alors why not, comme le disent les Fidjiens?
